Create a meal plan that incorporates fortified foods: Many foods, such as cereals and milk, are fortified with essential vitamins and minerals. By incorporating these foods into your diet, you can still get the nutrients you need even if fruits and vegetables disappear.

Ingest supplements: You can take supplements to make up for the nutrients that you would normally get from fruits and vegetables. However, it's important to talk to a healthcare professional before taking any supplements to ensure that they are safe and effective for you.

Ingest animal products: Meat, poultry, and fish are all good sources of essential vitamins and minerals. By incorporating these foods into your diet, you can still get the nutrients you need even if fruits and vegetables disappear.

Ingest dairy products: Milk, cheese, and yogurt are all good sources of essential vitamins and minerals. By incorporating these foods into your diet, you can still get the nutrients you need even if fruits and vegetables disappear.

Ingest plant-based sources of protein: Beans, lentils, and tofu are all good sources of essential vitamins and minerals. By incorporating these foods into your diet, you can still get the nutrients you need even if fruits and vegetables disappear.
